title.narrative: EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATIONS

description.narrative: By 2016, UNICEF is recognized by governments, civil society, media, private sector, children, adolescents and their families as a leading organization in the defense of children's and adolescents' rights, especially those who are most disadvantaged, through social mobilization and dissemination of qualified information and knowledge in a process which involves all these stakeholders, particularly children and adolescents., which contributes to Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Environmental Sustainability, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, governments at national and sub-national levels, media, corporate sector and civil society with increased capacities and knowledge on the most disadvantaged children, contributing to the universalization of Child Rights, supporting specific public policies addressing inequities and prioritizing boys and girls in public budgets.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, UNICEF is recognized by governments, civil society, media, private sector, children, adolescents and their families as aleading organization in the defense of children?s and adolescents? rights, especially those who are most disadvantaged, throughsocial mobilization and dissemination of qualified information and knowledge in a process which involves all these stakeholders,particularly children and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF surpassed its public outreach targets for the 2015-16 period by reaching 233 million people (goal was 90 million), engaging 6,9 million citizens (goal was 4.5 million) and influencing key public stakeholders to fulfill the rights of the most disadvantaged girls and boys. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2016

title.narrative: Reach and engagement (2): Number of people who participate in UNICEF's actions online and offline (excluding donations)

baseline.value: 159,263 people involved with UNICEF (in January 2013, online-only)

actual.value: 2016:More than 3.3 million people engaged through Facebook, Twitter and YouTube (shares, likes, comments and views).

title.narrative: Engagement (1) Number of adolescents engaged in communication and advocacy activities through the Platform of Urban Centers and the Municipal Seal of Approval in the Amazon and the Semi-arid.

actual.value: 2016:A total of 18,547 adolescents boys and girls producing and disseminating messages about the rights of children and adolescents through the Municipal Seal of Approval in the Amazon (10,492), Semi-arid (6,747) and the Platform of Urban Centres (1,308).

title.narrative: Voice (1): Percentage of UNICEF coverage in Brazilian top tier media that is favorable: (a) advances programme and/or advocacy goals or, (b) strengthens the brand

actual.value: 2016:The evaluation related to the media coverage to 2015 following the KPIs recommended by UNICEF Geneva commissioned in 2016 showed the great majority of the coverage (99%) were neutral. Due to methodological issues, the indicator will be revised for the next CPD 2017-2021.

title.narrative: Voice (2): Number of times that UNICEF publications are mentioned in the media

actual.value: 2016:Mentions to the following UNICEF publications: 453Humanitarian Action for Children: launched on January 26 (from January 26 to July 1, 2016): 46 mentions.Perils and Possibilities: Growing up online: launched on June 7 (from June 7 to July 1, 2016): 4 mentions.The Situation of the World's Children
